definition: banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: The flagpole has been a fixture since the building was first opened a century ago.
sentences.chinese: 這個旗杆從一個世紀前飯店開業起就一直固定在那裏。

sentences.english: The flagpole toppled over and a crane had to be used to erect it.
sentences.chinese: 旗杆倒下了，必須用起重機將它扶直。

sentences.english: The flagpole cuts across the photograph.
A players ball is resting against the flagstick.
sentences.chinese: 一名球員的球停靠在了旗杆旁邊。

sentences.english: A player plays from just off the putting green with the flagstick in the hole.
sentences.chinese: 當旗杆還在球洞裏的時候，一名球員從果嶺上打球。

sentences.english: Shall I hold the flagstick for you?
The ground was horizontal to the flagpole.
The player makes the stroke, looks up and sees the flagstick being attended.
sentences.chinese: 這名球員在擊球后才發現在有人在照管旗杆。

sentences.english: The gale blew down the flagstaff.
Paul chips approach shot onto green and close to flag.
sentences.chinese: 保爾近穴擊球，球落在了果嶺靠近旗杆處。

sentences.english: The Olympic flag, decorated with five rings, flutters at the top of a flagpole.
sentences.chinese: 旗杆上用五環裝飾的奧林匹克會旗迎風擺動。

sentences.english: It's as if your ascending levels of concentration have brought you to the top of a flag pole.
sentences.chinese: 這就好比上升的定力層次把你帶到了一根旗杆的頂點。

sentences.english: The building looked tiny and abandoned and there was no flag on the pole.
sentences.chinese: 建築看起來很小，廖無生氣，旗杆上也沒掛國旗。

sentences.english: The Marines placed the flagpole in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 海軍陸戰隊放置在地面的旗杆。

sentences.english: A flagpole loomed up through the mist.
sentences.chinese: 在薄霧中隱隱可見一根旗杆。

sentences.english: I caught a glimpse of Dizzy's mast hitting Dick fair and square on the top of his head.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥見迪西用旗杆在打迪克，正好擊中了他的頭。
